#Text=The outfits are usually based on original characters , known as  fursonas " .

column1: #Text=Guests of Honour Cherie and Sean O'Donnell , known within the community as " Lucky and Skuff Coyote " , held a session on fursuit construction on Saturday afternoon .
#Text=The married couple are among the most prominent builders in the fandom , under the name Do n't Hug Cacti .
#Text=The scale of their business was evident , as Sean had made over a thousand pairs of " handpaws " , costume gloves .
#Text=The couple encouraged attendees to continue developing their technique , sharing that all professional fursuit makers had developed different techniques .

#Text=They felt that they learned more from failed projects than successful ones , citing the Chuck Jones quote that " every artist has thousands of bad drawings , " and that you have to work through them to achieve .
#Text=Cherie , known as Lucky , recalled receiving a Sylvester the Cat plush toy from a Six Flags theme park at age 10 .
#Text=She promptly hollowed the toy out , turning it into a costume .
#Text=Creating a costume is n't without its hazards : the company uses 450°F ( 232°C ) glue guns .
#Text=They 're " like sticking your hand in an oven .

column3:
_	_	_	_
